A Data Manifest for Contextualized Telemetry Data A Data Manifest for Contextualized Telemetry Data
draft-ietf-opsawg-collected-data-manifest-09 draft-ietf-opsawg-collected-data-manifest-10
Abstract Abstract
Network platforms use Network Telemetry, such as YANG-Push, to Network platforms use Network Telemetry, such as YANG-Push, to
continuously stream information, including both counters and state continuously stream information, including both counters and state
information. This document describes the metadata that ensure that information. This document describes the metadata that ensure that
the collected data can be interpreted correctly. This document the collected data can be interpreted correctly. This document
specifies the data manifest, composed of two YANG data models (the specifies the data manifest, composed of two YANG data models (the
platform manifest and the non-normative data collection manifest). platform manifest and the non-normative data collection manifest).
These YANG modules are specified at the network level (e.g., network These YANG modules are specified at the network level (e.g., network

1. Introduction 1. Introduction
Network platforms use Network Telemetry, such as YANG-Push [RFC8641], Network platforms use Network Telemetry, such as YANG-Push [RFC8641],
to continuously stream information, including both counters and state to continuously stream information, including both counters and state
information. information.
This document specifies what needs to be kept as metadata to ensure This document specifies what needs to be kept as metadata to ensure
that the collected data can still be interpreted correctly throughout that the collected data can still be interpreted correctly throughout
the collection and network analytics toolchain. When streaming YANG- the collection and network analytics toolchain. When streaming YANG-
structured data with YANG-Push, there is a semantic definition in the structured data with YANG-Push, there is a semantic definition in the
corresponding YANG module definition. This is the semantic corresponding YANG module definition. This is the semantic
information for the collected data nodes: While this semantic is information for the collected data nodes: While this semantic is
absolutely required to correctly decode and interpret the data, absolutely required to correctly decode and interpret the data,
understanding the network platform and collection environment understanding the network platform and collection environment
contexts information is equally important to interpret the data. contexts information is equally important to interpret the data.
One part of this information is the actual collection period, as One part of this information is the actual collection period, as
opposed to the configured collection period. On some platforms, that opposed to the configured collection period. On some platforms, that
period can be adjusted automatically by the platform, for instance to period can be adjusted unilaterally by the platform, for instance to
reduce the load incurred by sending the telemetry. To later exploit reduce the load incurred by sending the telemetry. To later exploit
the collected data, getting this actual collection period is crucial. the collected data, getting this actual collection period is crucial.
This document defines a YANG model augmenting the YANG-Push model This document defines a YANG model augmenting the YANG-Push model
[RFC8641] to expose the actual collection period in Section 4. [RFC8641] to expose the actual collection period in Section 4.
This document introduces the data manifest, which is composed of two This document introduces the data manifest, which is composed of two
YANG modules, namely, the platform manifest and the data collection YANG modules, namely, the platform manifest and the data collection
manifest, to keep the collected data exploitable by the data manifest, to keep the collected data exploitable by the data
scientists and relevant tools. scientists and relevant tools.

streamed data. streamed data.
This document covers only metadata about the collection context for This document covers only metadata about the collection context for
the telemetry. The collected data is likely to be transformed into the telemetry. The collected data is likely to be transformed into
usable indicators for the network. The list of such transformation usable indicators for the network. The list of such transformation
operations applied to the data is often called data lineage. operations applied to the data is often called data lineage.
Supplying the data lineage for the computed indicators is out of Supplying the data lineage for the computed indicators is out of
scope of this document. scope of this document.

collected, three elements are necessary: the time of data emission, piece of data was collected, without having to access the platform
the originating platform and the subscription through which the data that emitted the telemetry. This retrieval requires three elements:
arrived. The approach described in this document delegates the time the time of data emission, the originating platform and the
retrieval to the database storing the collected telemetry and subscription through which the data arrived. The approach described
focusing on providing a way to match a platform and a subscription in this document assumes that an underlying database records the
identifier to the collection context. This is consistent with most history of both the data and the data manifest, enabling the data
of the YANG modules for devices, which focus on describing the analyst to temporally match the data and the data manifest.
current state of the device, rather than the evolution of that state Therefore, the approach presented here focuses on providing a way to
through time. match a platform and a subscription identifier to the collection
context. This is consistent with most of the YANG modules for
devices, which focus on describing the current state of the device,

2. Terminology 2. Terminology
The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT",
"SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and
"OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP
14 [RFC2119] [RFC8174] when, and only when, they appear in all 14 [RFC2119] [RFC8174] when, and only when, they appear in all
capitals, as shown here. capitals, as shown here.
This document reuses the term "Network Telemetry" as defined in This document reuses the term "Network Telemetry" as defined in
[RFC9232]. [RFC9232].
Platform: equipment of the network able to produce telemetry data. Platform: equipment in the network able to produce telemetry data.
Data manifest: The necessary data required to interpret telemetry Data manifest: The necessary data required to interpret telemetry
information. information.
Platform manifest: part of the data manifest that completely Platform manifest: part of the data manifest that characterizes the
characterizes the platform producing the telemetry information. platform producing the telemetry information.
Data collection manifest: part of the data manifest that completely Data collection manifest: part of the data manifest that
characterizes how and when the telemetry information was metered. characterizes how and when the telemetry information was metered.
Datapoint: an instance of data collected via Network Telemetry at a Datapoint: an instance of data collected via Network Telemetry at a
specific time. specific time.
Collector: software that receives the stream of telemetry. Collector: software that receives the stream of telemetry.

3.2. New Device Onboarding 3.2. New Device Onboarding
When a new device is onboarded, operators must check that the new When a new device is onboarded, operators must check that the new
device streams data (e.g., with YANG-Push), that the Network device streams data (e.g., with YANG-Push), that the Network
Telemetry data is the right one, that the data is correctly collected Telemetry data is the right one, that the data is correctly collected
at the data collection, and finally that the data can be analyzed at the data collection, and finally that the data can be analyzed
(compared with other similar devices). For the last point, the data (compared with other similar devices). For the last point, the data
manifest, which must be linked to the data up to the collection and manifest, which must be linked to the data up to the collection and
analytics system, contains the relevant information. analytics system, contains the relevant information, notably in the
case where the telemetry subscriptions are not configured by the
telemetry collectors.
3.3. Data Mesh Principles in Networking 3.3. Data Mesh Principles in Networking
The concept behind the data mesh [DataMesh] are: The concept behind the data mesh [DataMesh] are:
* Domain Ownership: Architecturally and organizationally align * Domain Ownership: Architecturally and organizationally align
business, technology, and analytical data, following the line of business, technology, and analytical data, following the line of
responsibility. The Data Mesh principles adopt the boundary of responsibility. The Data Mesh principles adopt the boundary of
bounded context to individual data products where each domain is bounded context to individual data products where each domain is
responsible for (and owns) its data and models. responsible for (and owns) its data and models.

collection which might be different from the configured collection collection period which might be different from the configured
period. collection period.

platform'), indexed by the identifier of the platform. That platform'), indexed by the identifier of the platform. That
identifier should be defined by the network manager so that each identifier should be defined by the network manager so that each
platform emitting Network Telemetry has a unique identifier. There platform emitting Network Telemetry has a unique identifier. There
are several documents about managing the inventory of the network, are several documents about managing the inventory of the network,
e.g., [I-D.ietf-ivy-network-inventory-yang]. The platform identifier e.g., [I-D.ietf-ivy-network-inventory-yang]. The platform identifier
should be the same as the identifier used in inventories or the should be the same as the identifier used in inventories or the
'node-id' in [RFC8345]. As an example, the identifier could be the 'node-id' in [RFC8345]. As an example, the identifier could be the
'sysName' from [RFC3418]. The scope of the "ietf-platform-manifest" 'sysName' from [RFC3418]. Selecting the correct identifier out of
module is the scope of the data collection, i.e., a given network, the existing works in IETF is out of scope for this document.
therefore it contains a collection of platform manifests, as opposed
to the device scope, which would contain a single platform manifest. The scope of the "ietf-platform-manifest" module is the scope of the
data collection, i.e., a given network, therefore it contains a
collection of platform manifests, as opposed to the device scope,
which would contain a single platform manifest. For a device-level
implementation the same module is used, including a single entry in
'platforms/platform', corresponding to the local view of the network
from the device point of view.

('name', 'software-version', 'software-flavor', 'os-version', and ('name', 'software-version', 'software-flavor', 'os-version', and
'os-type') that are aligned with the YANG Catalog 'os-type') that are aligned with the YANG Catalog
[I-D.clacla-netmod-model-catalog] so that the YANG Catalog could be [I-D.clacla-netmod-model-catalog] so that the YANG Catalog could be
used to retrieve the YANG modules a posteriori. The vendor of the used to retrieve the YANG modules a posteriori. The vendor of the
platform can be identified via its name 'vendor' or its PEN number platform can be identified via its name 'vendor' or its PEN number
